latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

item.title: Mashpee Wampanoag Tribe Reservation Reaffirmation Act

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 92.

item.title: Strengthening Health Care and Lowering Prescription Drug Costs Act

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 229 - 188 (Roll no. 206). (text: CR H3801)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 229 - 188 (Roll no. 206).(text: CR H3801)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 228 - 189, 1 Present (Roll no. 205). (consideration: CR H3812)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 377.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H3801-3813)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 23.

The resolution provides for 90 minutes of debate on H.R. 5, under a closed rule. Section 2 of the resolution provides for 60 minutes of debate on H.R. 312, under a closed rule and section 3 provides 90 minutes of debate on H.R. 987, under a structured rule.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 116-61, by Ms. Scanlon.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 116-61, by Ms. Scanlon.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5) to prohibit discrimination on the basis of sex, gender identity, and sexual orientation, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 312) to reaffirm the Mashpee Wampanoag Tribe reservation, and for other purposes; and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 987) to amend the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act to provide for Federal Exchange outreach and educational activities.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5) to prohibit discrimination on the basis of sex, gender identity, and sexual orientation, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 312) to reaffirm the Mashpee Wampanoag Tribe reservation, and for other purposes; and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 987) to amend the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act to provide for Federal Exchange outreach and educational activities.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
